website_summaries.verdict: The Nokia 3310 3G looks and feels like a 2005-era phone, which doesn't take advantage of 2017's voice technologies.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Senior Users
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for Senior Users find it difficult (impossible)!!!! to us a Smart phone , Clear voice calls & loud ring
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works a treat.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this phone a few days. I found it easy to set up and I'm very pleased with it. I like it's compact style and much prefer it to my old smartphone. I'm 74 and was never a fan of my smart phone, I found it difficult to use as a phone as I had to keep my hands off the touch screen, otherwise it would end or change the function. I swapped the sim card over and it was live straight away. I am finding it difficult however to get the internet connected. I've looked on the Vodafone website, but their instructions for the 3310 2017 model vary from mine.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Jervis

customer_reviews.title: Economical phone for emergency use.
customer_reviews.text: I keep this phone as an emergency reserve and bought it because I lost my previous 'dumb' phone. Accordingly, although the phone has 3G capability, I really only use it for making and receiving phone calls on a 'pay-as-you-go' basis. For that purpose it has proved admirable, but I cannot comment on its other features. It has a camera and I believe it can connect to the internet, but not through wifi.
customer_reviews.author: moonraker

customer_reviews.title: Not sim free,do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is not sim free!!!Bought for my mum,who is scared of technology,had so many sim cards sent to her,as the phone kept saying no sim!The phone is locked to vodaphone!One unhappy daughter, a stressed out Mum and cannot send it back!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This phone is a fake
customer_reviews.text: This phone was a fake! Bought the exact phone from John Lewis and the colour is different from this one, the graphics are better and overall phone works 10 times better. I would avoid buying the cheap version from amazon as its definitely a copy!!
customer_reviews.author: Ak

customer_reviews.title: Not the most reliable phone I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.text: Phone worked fine when I fist got it then after a month it started mysteriously resetting itself. Never got to the bottom of why it was resetting but ended up returning it to Amazon who gave a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rich.B

customer_reviews.title: No way to remove unwanted apps off the start screen
customer_reviews.text: Lots of pre-installed apps, but none of them can be removed :( Limited number of text messages that can be stored; even if you install a massive microsd. Other than that a really good phone. Battery life about 7-8 days depending on use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Ridgwell

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to read text messages
customer_reviews.text: The 2G version of this phone has a feature to allow you to change the size of the text when you receive a message. For some reason this has been removed in the 3G vesion of the phone. The text is tiny and almost impossible to read. Phone is now in the bin
customer_reviews.author: Rosscoe

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, handy, practical
customer_reviews.text: Basic phone, you get what you see. We don't use it for browsing as internet is slow and navigation rather complicated, also a bit slow in reacting. Love the yellow, found it a bit difficult to mute. This model has no options to choose different profiles, so you might want to opt for the slightly better model.
customer_reviews.author: K. Deas

customer_reviews.title: One Fixed font size on the 2017 3G version
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this was purchased for an elderly lady and font size cannot be changed from 'small' unlike the 2G version which has small and large options. The phone is nicely built, easy to use menus, nice screen (apart from font size :)) . I haven't experienced the battery life at all. It feels durable but it is slightly slippy so a case would be recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect First Phone For A Child
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old so he can contact me when walking to meet me on his own & I didn't want him having a 'smart phone' just yet. This is ideal, relatively basic, great battery life, still includes features for Facebook & twitter should someone want them. I can rest easy knowing he can contact me and if he loses it - it isn't the end of the world.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella & Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm
customer_reviews.text: I had an old version b4 was not good this is the 3g version much better now we just need watsapp sideload 2g one had better ui also this one died at half battery guna keep testing
customer_reviews.author: Linda C.

customer_reviews.title: Good seller
customer_reviews.text: It’s the classic Nokia so no touch screen, Picked up one of these on eBay but it was a very well made clone so glad this wasn’t as it was for my Dads birthday, simple and easy to use late birthday present now for my Dad but we are in lockdown here. Thanks this seller was speedy.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Davies

customer_reviews.title: Good no-frills phone
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use - put mine onto EE (PAYG) and it works fine on 2G or 3G - good sized easy to read screen - battery life seems decent (8-10 days) but depends on usage - the one thing I would say is keep a good grip on it as the case is very smooth and it will slip through your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Gordy

customer_reviews.title: Useless for shaky fingers
customer_reviews.text: Misleading information about size of keypad. Bought because large keys selling point. Very difficult to use with painful fingers.
customer_reviews.author: mark twain

customer_reviews.title: 'updated' model not as straightforward to use as the old one.
customer_reviews.text: the updated model is missing a few vital features of the old 3310 the back lighting is very dull even at the highest setting of 7, and font size cannot be increased which for older users is an issue. My Mum has had at least 3 3310's in the last few years so we expected the same from this version unfortunately we were disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Scutt

customer_reviews.title: Phone
customer_reviews.text: Can’t review this fairly as I didn’t keep phone bought for elderly relatives but soon discovered it wasn’t suitable for them . So gave it one star because I wouldn’t Be able to review it and say why I sent it back
customer_reviews.author: paige

customer_reviews.title: Cheap lookalike
customer_reviews.text: Retro usually involves sturdiness and nostalgia. This has neither. It’s a cheap plastic lookalike with a terrible touchscreen. Nothing like the real thing and with a highly inflated price. Don’t bother.
customer_reviews.author: M Munro

customer_reviews.title: Almost a weeks battery life on one full charge.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant battery life. Use it as a back up to my smart phone in the event i misplace or lose it. Can't fault it. It's my main phone for calls. I would advise anyone interested in a basic phone not wanting to use internet to buy. Very simple layout and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little mobile! Does exactly as expected. And for the money its very good value.
customer_reviews.author: 1Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Just keeps cutting out.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life may be a month on standby but it's only 2 days with normal use. The phone keeps droping calls. Sometimes 3/4 times in a conversation. I'm returning mine. Very disappointed in NOkia.
customer_reviews.author: LlamaLlama

customer_reviews.title: Retro Nostalgia!!
customer_reviews.text: Though not as iconic has the orignal 3310, the phone does a good job at nostalgia. The battery life awesome and can last upto a week if not used regularly.
customer_reviews.author: navneet krishnan

customer_reviews.title: stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The phone worked fine for a while and then suddenly stopped sending text messages. The sim works fine in all other phones so i contacted the company from whom i bought it and even though it is well withing one year of purchase they told me there was nothing they could and contact Nokia!
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Bad call quality
customer_reviews.text: 70% of calls are crackly and impossible to hear. Have to end the call and re dial which seems to fix the problem 50% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Buy the original this version is rubbish!!!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is so user unfriendly. The phone turns off and the torch turns on in your pocket even when the screen is locked DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware !
customer_reviews.text: was expecting great things from this phone but it fell well below expectation. Not good very difficult to use and no way as good as original nokia phones.
customer_reviews.author: derrick b winter

customer_reviews.title: Very  disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This phone is the most frustrating thing i've ever bought none of the buttons do what they should .i cant end a call and i cant adjust my settings ive downloaded the instruction manual and the phone buttons do not correspond to the instructions I wont be buying nokia again although ive always had a nokia and never had any problems at all
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Stannard

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: Phone is fake, bought another from car phone warehouse why is different. Would like a refund
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Morris

customer_reviews.title: Not a simple to use phone
customer_reviews.text: Phone glitchy... struggled to end a call repeatly - had to return this item as appears faulty
customer_reviews.author: Cha Bug

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with the new nokia 3310
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the new nokia 3310, & recommend it to all with on complications
customer_reviews.author: Philip reviews

customer_reviews.title: Battery life awful
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is awful. I bought this phone for my dad who barely even uses it only to answer and make calls. He never even uses the internet on it but still the battery does not last more than a day. After being fully charged the battery is dead by the afternoon making the phone useless. The phone is otherwise easy to use. When it stays on that is!
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Small, inexpensive, with days of battery life/
customer_reviews.text: No fuss, mobile phone. With no apps running continuously in the background your battery lasts for days (almost a week for me so far).
customer_reviews.author: Niel Archer

customer_reviews.title: awesome retro phone
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my technophobe mother who loved this phone originally. she now loves it again
customer_reviews.author: robert robertson

customer_reviews.title: Battery??
customer_reviews.text: A month standby?? Lasted 3 days. Ok in a poor signal area but still not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: F1

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't support much,
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't support much , you can't install missing language and support from Nokia is mediocre Other than that works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: ziad

customer_reviews.title: that it does what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: doesn't always lock, so when you put it in your pocket, anything can happen
customer_reviews.author: J Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Prompt delivery
customer_reviews.text: Not yet opened as Xmas gift, my husband will love it
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Battery would not charge also charger did not fit the phone Very disappointing was bought for a present for daughter who has learning difficulties she is very upset after waiting for it to arrived
customer_reviews.author: Lilian lomax

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: Not like the old version, but it’s ok for a spare
customer_reviews.author: yummy-mummy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to set up a diary on this phone, but it will only take twenty entries then states it's full. This makes it useless for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Bassett

customer_reviews.title: It’s secondhand not new
customer_reviews.text: I do not appreciate receiving secondhand products advertised as new
customer_reviews.author: BS

customer_reviews.title: nice size and feel
customer_reviews.text: nice size and feel. sometimes i didn't receive messages or phone calls. never happened until i started using this phone
customer_reviews.author: Haseeb S.

customer_reviews.title: Nokia 3310 3G
customer_reviews.text: I love my Nokia 3310 3G, I am so glad I bought it, the battery life is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecka Taylor-James

customer_reviews.title: Amazing classic
customer_reviews.text: a true classic the best phone ever battery amazing never drops a call and its clear the old phones were more reliable its just the new phones offer social media options
customer_reviews.author: Regional Care

customer_reviews.title: Great kid friendly phone
customer_reviews.text: As a phone for a football mad 11 yr old this is great. Takes dogs own abuse and rocks on - bright colour takes the sting out of being the only kid without a smart phone!
customer_reviews.author: Seamus

customer_reviews.title: Simple & easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a birthday present for my brother who is very pleased with it. He did not want a smartphone, just something simple to make calls & send text messages.
customer_reviews.author: Miss S.

customer_reviews.title: Great device all round
customer_reviews.text: Needed a basic phone but wanted something quality instead of cheap. Feels a decent device and so far has worked really well
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Homer

customer_reviews.title: Needs a micro sim
customer_reviews.text: Like bright yellow colour. Can be seen at bottom of my bag. But couldn’t transfer Sim from my old phone as the Nokia requires micro sim.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D.

customer_reviews.title: OK for a prison phone
customer_reviews.text: It's not touch screen and battery don't last long at all when on talk time
customer_reviews.author: sarah horley

customer_reviews.title: bought it for my wife
customer_reviews.text: my wife found it frustratingly difficult to operate and has gone back to her old 3310 so now have a phone I do not require.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Need to relearn using one key for multi letters, but otherwise a great phone
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use mobile phone!
customer_reviews.text: I like phone's menu as it's easy to use. And it's very handy! The duration of the battery could be longer.
customer_reviews.author: Rokas Stepaitis

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to use. Switches function without being touched. Completely dead after after 5 months. Rubbish!
customer_reviews.author: Mr S Coad

customer_reviews.title: Comes with incorrect plug for uk
customer_reviews.text: Sold in UK but has European plug which means unless you have a plug for UK it's unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Jada c.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Needed to be able to alter font it is very small but nice little phone
customer_reviews.author: MRS S.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Husband wanted a lightweight easy to use phone, he got it with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful design!
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and it is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Asif

customer_reviews.title: Easy to y
customer_reviews.text: Nice shape good colour EASY to use delivered well inside stated .and it tipical Nokia
customer_reviews.author: C. Ticehurst

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and infuriating Nokia
customer_reviews.text: Basic? Previous Nokias far easier to use. This 3310 3G has more than 1 option on the “call” and “end call” buttons making it easy to turn the phone off by mistake - INFURIATING. The main menu button has an outer ring which is very fiddly because of the small size. Contacts and Messaging much more complicated than previous Nokia’s. My £10 on pay-as-you-go disappeared and after ringing my provider (Virgin), I was told it has APPS which update in the background which had used my data even though mobile data was turned off !
customer_reviews.author: S A ELLIS

customer_reviews.title: Beware.....phone is locked to a network please check before you purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Nokia 3310 as a second phone. Please beware this phone is locked to the Vodafone network, Nowhere in the item description does it state it is locked to a network. The seller was unhelpful he/she said I should have checked before I made purchase!. Item desription is misleading but phone does the job on Vodafone!. Mum got a great gift and I have purchased an unlocked Nokia from a reliable source.
customer_reviews.author: Bev5

customer_reviews.title: My husband is very pleased with phone but is very displeased with instructions as ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband is very pleased with phone but is very displeased with instructions as are all foreign not one English instruction amongst them very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Janice C.

customer_reviews.title: Inside the house is great. In the street you can not see anything ...
customer_reviews.text: Inside the house is great. In the street you can not see anything because the plastic that protects the display is mirrored. You can not increase the size of the fonts.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Martins

customer_reviews.title: Faulty calls and short battery life
customer_reviews.text: Sadly the phone is pretty bad when comes to calls, which frequently results in one person not being able to hear the other or the call failing within seconds. Also for a phone that should have very little energy requirements it has a ridiculously short battery life!
customer_reviews.author: Sam S.

customer_reviews.title: Value for money.
customer_reviews.text: my Last Nokia only lasted 15 Months. It was good while it lasted so I am hoping this one last quite a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Happy latte drnker

customer_reviews.title: Phone is locked to network despite being sim free
customer_reviews.text: Phone is locked to Vodafone, was expecting it to be unlocked as it's sim free and doesn't say anywhere about it being tied to a network... Rather disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gremlin Overlord

customer_reviews.title: transmission quality poor, software issues
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made, transmission quality poor, software issues, bought as emergency backup, but, in all honesty don't think I could live with it even for a day!
customer_reviews.author: misterKris

customer_reviews.title: Fanatic phone worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic basic phone. Strongly recommend for those who wish to make and receive phone calls only.
customer_reviews.author: kindle

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: its amazing for the price, but ... you cant change the text font... wtf?? otherwise pretty good, when i get used to it will prob raise it to 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a true 3310 successor.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the plastic on this phone is terrible. The phone arrived scratched, and it scratched again within 24 hours. The UI is fine, except there are trial versions of games installed that cannot be removed (and I'm not talking about the classic snake game). There is a web browser, but it is out of date by four versions, and even websites (like my own) which have no adverts on them display advertising. This isn't a real Nokia phone like they were in the old days. In fact, this phone isn't even made by Nokia, just a company licencing the name. If you're expecting one, then I'd buy a classic one from an auction site instead.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as the old 3310.
customer_reviews.text: A bit disappointed in this phone, not what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: smokeysco

customer_reviews.title: it switches off when it feels like it.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars I would.. it is without doubt the biggest pile of rubbish I have ever had the misfortune to own.. it switches off when it feels like it.. it truely is junk it was pre used and set to Spanish.. not new... oh well, you learn by your mistakes and you get what you pay for...never again... not recommended
customer_reviews.author: Ray milbourn

customer_reviews.title: So Dissapointed with this
customer_reviews.text: Wanted so much to like this ,for what it is a basic Moby ,BUT the big no no for me is inability to turn off permanently T9 predictive text every time you write a text it defaults to T9, Micro sim is No problem just cut down your full size, Could have been so much better
customer_reviews.author: Jonboy

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: A very suitable phone for a relative in their late 60's who doesn't want to start learning how to use a smartphone. It feels very good in the hand, has a nice clear display and good battery which charges to full in around an hour. If I wanted a good basic phone to make calls from and text this would probably be the one. However, I'm spoilt by the capabilities and quality of life improvements smartphones can offer. I also have to agree with some others that nostalgia should be kept in the past, less you realise all the bad things that have been repressed. I highly recommend this phone sock:
customer_reviews.author: Equilibrium

customer_reviews.title: Nokia 33103G phone,
customer_reviews.text: Lovely phone, I'm just getting used to the keyboard as my previous phone was a qwerty keyboard, very nice all round though I wish I could delete the games. The seller was good, goods service and quick delivery, I would recommend this seller .
customer_reviews.author: Janet MacIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Not as good.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little bit disappointed with this phone, first the basic operating system for texting is not as good as my older Nokia phones, then there's the buttons them selves, in the bright day light there ok, in the dark there ok but in a room they become a problem. In the old days you either had a black button with light digits so when they are back lit you could read them or the buttons were white or clear with black digits again when back lit they worked, but now Nokia use silver buttons with a black digit that goes clear or a silvery colour when back lit so you can not read the button symbols, most annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable battery
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model Nokia which was very easy to use. I find the new one less easy especially when typing texts and want to use a capital letter mid sentence. I don't use text abbreviations. My main problem is with the battery. This morning it showed half full yet within an hour the phone died. This has happened several times and is infuriating. I get little or no warning it is running low, it just dies. I don't use my phone for anything other that calls and texts but need advanced notice of battery life.
customer_reviews.author: wendy bellamy

customer_reviews.title: Nokia 3310
customer_reviews.text: I forgot how to use these and I must say after using an iPhone they are hard to use !! Ok for a second mobile for holiday as that’s what I use it for button are a bit difficult as so tiny . It is what it is , touch screen mobiles have unfortunately made life using a mobile so much easier. I wouldn’t choose to use this all the time. The colour is great as you can find it in your handbag or where you’ve laid it down.
customer_reviews.author: Tuppence

customer_reviews.title: A simple phone to use
customer_reviews.text: I have liked the nokia 3310 for some time it was one of my first phones. But now Nokia has re-released the new version of the Nokia 3310 and I wanted a simple phone for use at work just to make phone calls and this phone does not disappoint. I have the phone for a week now and it still has a full charge in it and the signal strength is always full bars unlike my smartphone which I have to charge every day and the signal strength at work is terrible. The older phones were the best. I love this phone because it is simple to use and no wi fi, its great.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Ormsby

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgic phone but very basic.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful for nostalgia or if you don't want smartphone features, very frustrating if you do. Feels cheaper than the old 3310, and the battery isn't as good (but far better than smartphones). Good conversation piece. Old style predictive text drove me up the wall in no time at all...
customer_reviews.author: tim d

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Nokia 3310, I'm more than happy with it. Its a great basic phone, very easy to set up and use. The buttons are so soft, so when texting its made easy. You will need a case for it to sit in, cause its outer case is very smooth, and could slide out your hand. I would recommended this mobile. Great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. leadbetter

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sharp display on texting, with previous conversation displayed. Love the little camera which has many features for only 2mb, including sharpness. On wifi will pick up on BBC news and Google but of course slow. Clear reception on phone calls, ideal for those on PAYGO.
customer_reviews.author: g g harris

customer_reviews.title: I already bought a replacement
customer_reviews.text: I tried to have a non-smart phone. I don't need a smart phone most of the time. But one day I was lost and google maps just isn't a thing on one of these. And that sealed its fate. I don't need a smartphone most of the time, but I want the functionality if I do need it just in case. I bought a nokia smartphone for £99 to replace this already.
customer_reviews.author: SwampPuppet

customer_reviews.title: China buggy copy and not expensive
customer_reviews.text: There are some games that i don’t need them and the software occasionally hangs (the only fix is to remove the battery). Not even close to the quality we use to receive from Nokia.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Great phone unless you want to call someone.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great phone for nostalgia purposes, but for practical use, forget it. The quality of in call sound is terrible. You can barely hear anything during phone calls regardless of volume settings. It's basically only good for Snake and texting.
customer_reviews.author: Andus Mcabu

customer_reviews.title: Dont bother
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised a brand like Nokia put their name to this. It is cheap plastic, not fit for purpose. Call quality is really poor and menu's dont work. I have had this phone 6 weeks and it is unusable, unfortunately I cannot return it so it goes in the bin!
customer_reviews.author: Headmoss

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with product the only thing that is annoying is that I have had numbers come up when it's in my bag even though it was on lock it hasn't rung any so far maybe I will look into getting a case
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a bit of a let down
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for a smartphone detox. However the device is hampered by the Bluetooth, which will not connect to my car and very small text which cannot be increased. The 3g reception in EE is very poor compared to my smartphone. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Mr D.J.Priestley

customer_reviews.title: Wrong phone delivered
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this may be a very good phone. However, by the time it was delivered it had morphed into a Nokia 8110 which was nothing like the phone I'd ordered!! Needless to say it's going straight back. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Devonshire Dumpling 67

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Wouldn’t buy if I could turn back time
customer_reviews.text: Too basic. No what’s app. No pic sharing. No contact sharing. And not that easy to use. The snake game is absolute nonsense nothing like it was. Hardly gets reception
customer_reviews.author: Ausra

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Hubby only wanted a basic upgrade without all the technical gadgets. Great phone - you can choose from many colours & it has a nice size screen. Slightly larger than the original Nokia
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a dual sim
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as a dual sim, the instructions that come with it even say dual sim but the phone is NOT a dual sim model.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie the scot! Not scottish tho! Bit french!

customer_reviews.title: A brilliant basic phone.
customer_reviews.text: I love these phones. I've had 2 - lost the first one. I am not tech savvy so this phone meets all my needs.
customer_reviews.author: David Alec Pybus

customer_reviews.title: He loved it, is actually using it as second device
customer_reviews.text: Blast from the past! I got this as a present for a Nokia obsessed friend. He loved it, is actually using it as second device.
customer_reviews.author: d2d_2

customer_reviews.title: Frankly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Terrible battery life and s middling interface. The interface I could live with but the battery kind of ran against the point of the phone. Shame, as otherwise it was nice to have
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Father in law is very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: Father in law is very pleased with it, great little phone to make calls on and send/receive texts
customer_reviews.author: Simon Calaby

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Replaced sons smart phone and it works brilliant he actually prefers this. The yellow is bright so easy to find lying in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Old style simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Old style phone does what I need it too without all the gizmos on today’s modern phones
customer_reviews.author: K. Watts

customer_reviews.title: so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: this is a brilliant phone. to keep as a spare or to give to someone who just prefers Nokia basic but would like a bigger version. very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. M. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Bought for grandson for his 10th birthday. He’s thrilled with it. Easy to use and excellent value for money
customer_reviews.author: Not right

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while getting used to it.
customer_reviews.text: Not as user friendly as my old, battered nokia. No instructions. How do I record a voice mail message? Love the size, shape and colour. I find it a nuisance having to scroll through my contacts to make a call.
customer_reviews.author: e.o.

product_meta.title: Nokia 3310 3G SIM-Free Feature Phone - Charcoal
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:Charcoal

FABULOUS NOKIA 3310 UK-SIM FREE FEATURE PHONE
Exceptionally iconicrounded form, updated The new Nokia 3310 takes the iconic silhouette of the original and reimagines it for 2017. The custom designed user interface brings a fresh look to a classic, whilst the 2.4” polarised and curved screen window makes for better readability in sunlight.

ROBUST AND BOUNDLESS BATTERY ANDSNAKE AROUND!
Good times: remember when you could leave the house without a charger? Well, with the new Nokia 3310, you can. It comes with a long-lasting battery, so you can talk all day, or leave the phone on standby for up to a month. When needed, a Micro-USB port makes charging simple.

Wistfully Play the legendary Snake. It’s back with a little update that makes it even more fun to play on the colour screen. Do you still remember your high score? Think you can beat it?

OUR NOKIA 3310 IS MADE TO FIT YOUR STYLE.
Zany: it comes in four distinct colours: Warm Red and Yellow, both with a gloss finish, and Dark Blue and Grey both with a matte finish. What’s best, the colour runs through the material, so it looks better for longer.

Ergonomically beautiful push buttons and iconic shaped design, 2 MP camera with LED flash for simple snaps, headphone jack for your tunes, 2.4” curved window with polarised layer for better readability in sunlight.

Rapid 2G connectivity for calling and texting, all-new UI with nods to the original, awesome battery life, with up to 22 hours talk time, FM radio and MP3 player for music, 16 MB storage plus a MicroSD card slot with support up to 32 GB

ELEGANTLY MODERN CLASSIC REIMAGINED




BOX CONTAINS
1 x Nokia 3310
Charger
Battery
User guide
feature_bullets: 32GB microSD slot, FM radio, LED torch
3G network connectivity. 2 MP camera with LED flash
